_comment: Created by ianb on 01/08/2014 12:39:25 using v2.1
title: Overall, how patients rate the care they receive?
analysis_commentary: Starting in 2012, inpatients were asked to rate their overall care experience on a zero to 10 scale (0 being a poor experience and 10 a very good experience). Similar to 2012, in 2013, 87% of inpatients rated their care with a score of six or above, although there was an increase in the proportion of patients reporting the highest levels of satisfaction, with 48% giving either a 9 or 10 rating. This can be compared to the 43% of patients who rated the care they received as 'Excellent' in 2011.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Survey of Adult Inpatients
